page.title: 13Recollections
page.content: {Mr. Clark. Mayor of Sandhurst,}told us about his childhood in the{193O's. He was born at home with help from the District Nurse. Milk came from Ambarrow Farm. Some farmers illegally watered it down. Altogether there were 8 farms in Sandhurst. He attended the Methodist School on School Hill, which later became New Scotland Hill. Lessons were split between schools, girls travelled 2.5 miles to Broadmoor School for 0.5 days Domestic Science. His father-in-law worked at Wellington College as a carpenter. Mr. Clark later worked there as a steward. For a Sunday School treat they walked to Blackwater Station and travelled to Wellington College Halt which was built of a few railway sleepers.
